titleStmt.title: The Merry maid of Shoreditch, her resolution and good counsel to all her fellow maids; and says that she will never tye her self to a crab tree so long as she has a whole wood to range in. : The tune is, I have a mistris of my own: or, Hold buckle and thong together.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Deacon, at the Angel in Guilt-Spur-street without Newgate.,

notesStmt.note: Date of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.

place.placeName: the Angel in Guilt-Spur-street without Newgate.
